contentrichtext.text: {{Roman myth (trade)}} In [[Roman mythology]], '''Laverna''' was a goddess of [[thieves]], [[cheats]] and the [[underworld]]. She was propitiated by libations poured with the left hand. The poet [[Horace]] and the playwright [[Plautus]] call her a goddess of thieves. In [[Rome, Italy|Rome]], her sanctuary was near the [[Porta Lavernalis]]. ==References== {{Wikisource1911Enc}} Michael Jordon, ''Encyclopedia of Gods'', Kyle Cathie Limited, 2002 [[Category:Commerce goddesses]] [[Category:Roman goddesses]] [[Category:Trickster goddesses]] [[Category:Underworld goddesses]] {{AncientRome-myth-stub}}
